result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole L Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA proof of submission - original

Defendant is able to explain to the Court what a trial is today.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court orders $100 + costs, DNA sample and 30 days jail w/Huber and credit for 9 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 11:15 am

This case was set for a plea and sentencing hearing at 8:30 am this morning.  Cole Danielson did not appear.  Atty Siehr had tried calling him but did not get an answer.  Court authorized a warrent but would hold off signing it until 1:30 pm.
Cole Danielson with Atty Siehr appear at 11:00 am.  A new $500.00 cash bond set in this case.  A new plea and sentencing hearing is set for January 22, 2016 at 11:15 am.

After questioning and explaining rights partially the defendant answers the Judges questions indicating he wants a trial.  Then he changes his mind, seems confused.  Explains he hasn't ever been through anything like this.  Didn't understand Judge's questions.  Judge questions defendant and isn't willing to proceed today.  Reschedule for a later date.
Defendant Cole L Danielson in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 08:30 am
State's

Attorney Gabriel Siehr in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's attorney enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
for appearance
Gabriel Siehr

Defendant Cole L Danielson in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now laid off.  Defendant on vacation next week.  Court advises this case is a priority and must have attorney first before vacation plans  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cole L Danielson in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Currently employed, doesn't qualify for PD.  Court wants defendant to come back next week with a plan to hire counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pictures & prints.

Defendant Cole L Danielson in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA makes his recommendation for fine, costs and 30 days jail.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
